page.title: 06Thurnham
page.content: Abreast/herringbone milking parlours are used. There is a computer controlled concentrate input on one farm. Milk goes into jars then by pipeline into a stainles-steel refrigerated tank. Milk Marketing Board tankers collect daily. Milk goes to Bamber Bridge for pasteurising and resale; to Garstang for cheese; or Kendal for butter. Concentrates have been reduced since milk quotas were introduced and there is some anxiety about future policy of Government and E.E.C. toward dairy farming. Silage quality this year (l985) was poor because of the wet summer; the barley was harvested late; and more concentrates were needed to maintain the milk quality and yield.
